messages.title: 60 SECOND Q&A
messages.content: Stephen answers key questions on taxes, public services, bureaucracy, local government, climate change.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plans to boost jobs by cutting corporation tax and reversing the national insurance hike.
Aiming not to reduced public services but to make them more competitively priced.
Conservatives are set against bureaucracy and will seek to control and reduce it.
Conservatives believe that local decisions should be made locally, with local issues taking precedence over long-term sustainability concerns.
Acknowledges the importance of the issue but emphasizes the need to balance with day to day issues.

mentions.candidate: Stephen has been an actively engaged in the development of Leicestershire public service policy.
mentions.partyLeader: David Cameron will ensure that local issues take precedence.

issues.education: The Conservatives will reduce bureaucracy in the education service.
issues.health: The Conservatives will increase the NHS budget and reduce bureaucracy, empowering doctors and nurses.

politicalExperience.achievements: Senior minister in the last Conservative government.

images.caption: Stephen Dorrell Q&A and Factfile, support for the NHS, schools, and safe communities.
